description: This East Sussex village is located near Winchelsea and Rye in the Rother district of the county. This circular walk from the village uses part of the 1066 Country Walk to visit neighbouring Winchelsea. The return leg includes a pleasant waterside section along the Royal Military Canal Path. Please scroll down for the full list of walks near and around Icklesham. The detailed maps below also show a range of footpaths, bridleways and cycle paths in the area.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: The Robin Hood is an historic 17th century pub. There is a magnificent open fire and a large dining area to the rear offers locally sourced, home cooked food. The pub hosts pool and pétanque teams and is the home of the local Bonfire Society. There is a large garden to sit out in on warmer days. It also has a children’s play area. You can find them at postcode TN36 4BD. They are dog friendly.

display_address: Main Road, Icklesham, Winchelsea, Rother, East Sussex, England, TN36 4BH, United Kingdom
